keywords: This book presents lucid treatment of a wide range of issues involved in Operations Management. It emphasises on the analysis and quantitative techniques for the overall role of Operations Management in organisations; which aim at maximising their productivity and profitability.; The book further discusses in detail decision-making methodology; design of product; process and production system. Decision-making methodology focuses on economic models and statistical models in Chapter 2. Design of process and product is given in Chapter 6. System and capacity design explained in Chapter 3. The facility location and layout; demand forecasting and materials management helpful to streamline the production activities is included in Chapters 4; 5 and 6. Material requirement planning and aggregate planning required to achieve the forecasted demand; is explained in Chapter 8 and 9. Scheduling and controlling production activities essential for maintaining effective operations are explained in Chapter 10.; Primarily designed as a textbook for various courses like B.E.; MBA and also useful for students perusing courses BBM; PGDBA from Bangalore and other Indian Universities.; Key Features; Book is written in simple and lucid style.; Contents are present in a most meticulous manner.; Charts are provided for easy understanding of the concepts.; Focuses on operations management concepts and techniques.; Focuses on decision-making methodologies.; Focuses on product and process design.; Focuses on materials management.; Focuses on material Requirement Planning concepts and technique.; Focuses on capacity requirement planning concepts.; Focuses on aggregate planning concepts and techniques.; Focuses on scheduling concepts and techniques.; Exercises are designed for self-evaluation and include analytical type and application type questions.; Contains examination question bank; Contains exhaustive glossary of terminologies.

captionwriter: Dr. S. Anil Kumar is Professor and HOD of Commerce and Management, NMKRV College for Women, Bangalore, is an eminent scholar and has a wide academic and research experience of more than 25 years in the field of commerce and management. He has authored books on `Marketing Strategies for Pharmaceutical Products`, `Services Marketing`, `Entrepreneurship Development`, `Management Accounting`, `Company Law and Secretarial Practice`, `Production and Operations Management` , `Small Business and Entrepreneurship` and `Financial Accounting Volume I, II, III for UG and PG courses of Bangalore University and other universities. He has presented papers in International and National Conferences. He was an academic member of Bangalore University. He has produced many M.Phils. and has been guiding for Doctoral Degree.

bag: This book presents lucid treatment of a wide range of issues involved in Operations Management. It emphasises on the analysis and quantitative techniques for the overall role of Operations Management in organisations
which aim at maximising their productivity and profitability.
The book further discusses in detail decision-making methodology
design of product

process and production system. Decision-making methodology focuses on economic models and statistical models in Chapter 2. Design of process and product is given in Chapter 6. System and capacity design explained in Chapter 3. The facility location and layout
demand forecasting and materials management helpful to streamline the production activities is included in Chapters 4
5 and 6. Material requirement planning and aggregate planning required to achieve the forecasted demand
is explained in Chapter 8 and 9. Scheduling and controlling production activities essential for maintaining effective operations are explained in Chapter 10.
Primarily designed as a textbook for various courses like B.E.
MBA and also useful for students perusing courses BBM
PGDBA from Bangalore and other Indian Universities.
Key Features
Book is written in simple and lucid style.
Contents are present in a most meticulous manner.
Charts are provided for easy understanding of the concepts.
Focuses on operations management concepts and techniques.
Focuses on decision-making methodologies.
Focuses on product and process design.
Focuses on materials management.
Focuses on material Requirement Planning concepts and technique.
Focuses on capacity requirement planning concepts.
Focuses on aggregate planning concepts and techniques.
Focuses on scheduling concepts and techniques.
Exercises are designed for self-evaluation and include analytical type and application type questions.
Contains examination question bank
Contains exhaustive glossary of terminologies.
